title.narrative: Strengthening and Recovering our Way of Life: Indigenous Families in the Chaco

description.narrative: The Strengthening and Recovering Our Way of Life: Indigenous Families in Chimborazo and Cotopaxi Secure Local, Healthy Food Project will be carried out with the Chimborazo Indigenous Movement Confederation (COMICH) and the Cotopaxi Indigenous Small-Farmer Movement (MICC). Changes underway in both provinces are replacing the production and consumption of highly nutritious and medicinal products with processed foods such as pasta, sodas and the like. This change has resulted in inadequate nutrition among families as well as the disappearance of native foods from children’s nutrition programs in the territory and the consequential loss of knowledge pertaining to native foods. This project will assist in the recovery of ancestral production practices on plots that will become centers for learning and information dissemination. Additionally, the project will facilitate public policy advocacy at the local level to have native, healthy and locally-produced products included in the state’s food programs for children. A total of 200 original families will receive seeds, animals (guinea pigs, rabbits, sheep, cows, doves and chickens) and infrastructure for livestock shelters and irrigation. An additional 200 families will benefit through Heifer’s Pass on the Gift process. Also, 112 individuals/organizational leaders will benefit from ongoing training processes on advocacy for the consumption and production of healthy, native foods; and they will replicate their training with another 112 leaders.
